image.altText: two women sitting at a table looking through documents

props.synopsis: It's been a long and exhausting journey, and even a legally-binding order made by a civil tribunal may not have brought their fight to an end.

title.children: 'We just want to have long service leave': Workers' long fight for entitlements

image.altText: A man faces the camera in a mughsot, with long dark braids and wearing a blue t-shirt.

props.synopsis: Police were searching for Thor Kristiansen for a week after receiving multiple reports including property damage and driving offences.

title.children: Thor Kristiansen arrested after manhunt through Canberra's streets

image.altText: Lisa Wilkinson smiling enters Federal Court in Sydney before Bruce Lehrmann defamation judgment, media around

props.synopsis: Federal Court Justice Michael Lee expresses frustration over further delays in the costs battle between journalist Lisa Wilkinson and Network Ten over the Bruce Lehrmann defamation case, telling the court he wants an end to his involvement in it.

title.children: 'I want to bring this to an end': Frustration in court over costs dispute between Ten and Wilkinson

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: The man was found guilty last year of unauthorised camping on unleased national land after sleeping in his car in the National Rock Garden carpark near Canberra's Lake Burley Griffin.

title.children: Judge finds homeless man who slept in his car on national land was parking there not camping

image.altText: Three large metal structures in a paddock with cows.

props.synopsis: The federal government has green-lit a southern NSW project that will form a key part of its plan to connect more renewable energy to the grid.

title.children: Controversial $4.8b Snowy 2.0 transmission project gets federal approval

image.altText: Generic photo of people swimming in the ocean at an Adelaide beach on a hot day.

props.synopsis: Christmas Day is looking dry and sunny for most of the country, with a distinctive lack of rain-producing low-pressure systems, troughs or cold fronts appearing on the charts.

title.children: Canberra set for warm and sunny Christmas Day, with heatwave to come later

image.altText: An artist's impression showing Europa Clipper nearing Jupiter.

props.synopsis: A team at the Canberra Deep Space Communication Complex is tasked with making "first contact" with NASA's largest and most expensive spacecraft, the Europa Clipper, on its journey to Jupiter's fourth-largest moon.

title.children: Deep space experts tracking NASA mission to Jupiter's fourth-largest moon

image.altText: a man smiles holding a handful of oysters up and water in the background

props.synopsis: The countdown to Christmas is on and oyster farmers on the NSW south coast are embracing what is shaping up to be the best season in nearly a decade.

title.children: Pearler of a Christmas ahead for these oyster farmers

image.altText: A graphic of a road caution sign for Kiwis, lying flat on the road.

props.synopsis: New Zealand's economy has slipped into one of the developed world's worst recent recessions, but it seems like the Reserve Bank of Australia is avoiding the same mistakes.

title.children: New Zealand's recession shows how the RBA dodged a bullet

image.altText: A man in green military attire sits in a blue chair speaking in to a small microphone during an address

props.synopsis: Ukrainian sources were quick to background journalists to say they were behind the killing of Russian General Igor Kirillov. Experts say it's likely not that simple.

title.children: Did Russian resistance kill one of the country's top generals?

props.synopsis: A small farming town in regional WA is bucking the trend of shrinking populations. Tambellup has seen an 8 per cent increase in the past 12 months as cheap house prices lure more people to the arid countryside.

title.children: Cheap inland houses are prompting a 'dry barren landscape change'

image.altText: a red Tesla Model 3 sedan is charged at a Tesla dealership with the Tesla logo shown on the dealership building in the back

props.synopsis: Essential workers like police and nurses, and those  earning less than $100,000 a year will be able to purchase electric vehicles using low-interest loans that the federal government says will save them thousands of dollars in interest.

title.children: Low-interest electric vehicle loans for workers earning less than $100k

image.altText: Rainbow flag flying outside Australian Parliament House.

props.synopsis: LGBTQIA+ advocates say the data can help inform government decisions about Australia's sex- and gender-diverse community.

title.children: Around 4.5 per cent of the population is LGBTQIA+, ABS estimates

image.altText: people on platform with trains

props.synopsis: Sydney commuters are warned of major train delays and cancellations in the lead up to Christmas, after the Rail, Tram and Bus Union had a win in the Federal Court.

title.children: Sydney trains action could have 'significant impact today', union says

image.altText: NSW Premier Chris Minns speaks to the media during a press conference at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse December 7, 2023

props.synopsis: NSW Premier Chris Minns will not be investigated by the state's corruption watchdog over a proposal to develop Sydney's Rosehill Racecourse into housing.

title.children: Chris Minns won't be investigated for Rosehill Racecourse, ICAC says

image.altText: Floodwaters block off a regional road.

props.synopsis: An emergency alert was issued earlier this morning for Jandowae Creek in the Western Downs, with residents in low-lying areas urged to leave.

title.children: Teenage boy swept into stormwater drain as heavy rain lashes Queensland

image.altText: Woman lying in bed looking at her phone. She's lying on her side and looks a bit sad while looking at the phone screen.

props.synopsis: It's been six months since the Labor government announced plans to retrospectively change the way student debts were increased. Now people are finally seeing the changes come through.

title.children: How to check how much you got back thanks to HECS indexation changes

image.altText: fire through the bushland overhead shot

props.synopsis: Properties have come under threat near Victoria's Grampians National Park after a bushfire ripped through more than 5,000 hectares of land in just 24 hours.

title.children: Fire in Victoria's Grampians grows 10 times bigger in a day

image.altText: A close up of hand holding a fuel pump at the bowser

props.synopsis: Fuel prices are set to rise in multiple major cities over the festive season, according to the peak body for motoring and travel.

title.children: Fuel prices to increase in most cities ahead of Christmas, peak motoring body says

image.altText: People line up to board a royal australian air force plane in vanuatu

props.synopsis: The death toll in Vanuatu following two earthquakes has been revised to nine but is expected to rise as there are fears for people still trapped under buildings.

title.children: 148 Australians return home on RAAF flights as aid teams arrive in Vanuatu

image.altText: John in a library

props.synopsis: Choosing a favourite John Marsden book is a tough gig. Looking back at his more-than-40 works, ABC Arts reviewers share the novel that moved them the most.

title.children: Looking back on the best books of the late, great John Marsden

image.altText: Clare sits in front of a row of windows at parliament house.

props.synopsis: The government has found a legislative workaround to restrict how many international students can study in Australia, after laws to impose caps were rejected by the Coalition and Greens.

title.children: International student numbers to be limited using legal workaround

image.altText: Sally Catherall standing in her front yard.

props.synopsis: The ABC speaks to those who took alternative and complementary medicines after a cancer diagnosis and asks how they navigated their beliefs.

title.children: Cancer patient told she wasn't 'positive enough' when turmeric didn't work

image.altText: The bomb blast scene in Kuta several days after the bomb blasts.

props.synopsis: Australia asks Malaysia for assurances that two men who admitted conspiring in the Bali bombings are being closely monitored following their repatriation from Guantanamo Bay.

title.children: 'Terrorists shouldn't get deals': Bali bomb duo's transfer sparks anger

image.altText: A dozen King Island Dairy double brie cheese wheels splayed with their labels showing.

props.synopsis: Premier Jeremy Rockliff calls on Canadian dairy giant Saputo to "back Tasmania" and find a buyer for its King Island Dairy.

title.children: Tasmanian premier accuses Saputo of trying to kill off King Island Dairy rather than sell

image.altText: A slightly gaunt middle aged white man with tortoiseshell glasses looks sombre in front of a microphone

props.synopsis: Shayne Elliott withdraws the vote on his performance bonus after shareholders voiced disapproval with regulatory investigations into the bank by the financial watchdog.

title.children: ANZ CEO forfeits $3.2m bonus after shareholder disapproval

image.altText: Woman smiling at camera

props.synopsis: Daniel Billings, who is alleged to have murdered childcare worker and mother Molly Ticehurst, has been charged with four additional offences.

title.children: Fresh charges against Molly Ticehurst's accused killer, including rape

image.altText: A man with sun-bleached hair hold a new surfboard upright while another man embraces him, grinning.

props.synopsis: Sam Taylor was trying to reach a swimmer struggling in a rip when he found himself in similar trouble on a New South Wales beach, but a nearby 14-year-old came to his aid.

title.children: Teen surfer with 'a big heart' praised for brave double rescue

image.altText: A man loads a white bag into the trunk of a red sedan car in northern spain

props.synopsis: Spanish police say a Google Street View image allegedly showing a man loading a bag into a car has helped them make two arrests in a murder case.

title.children: Google Maps helps catch alleged killers as it snaps man loading car with suspected body

image.altText: Child holding hand

props.synopsis: Children with disability are frequently misunderstood by responders, slip through the cracks of multiple service providers and can at times be used as weapons, parents and advocates say.

title.children: NDIS plans of children with disability weaponised by abusive parents

image.altText: Men in suits sit before Australian and USA flags.

props.synopsis: A government review has recommended its US office no longer receive public funding, as part of a broader review of national security research.

title.children: Foreign policy think tank ASPI set for public funding cut

image.altText: Yung Filly smiling on stage holding a microphone.

props.synopsis: UK rapper and YouTube star Yung Filly admits to driving at more than 50 kilometres per hour above the speed limit on a Perth highway while he was on bail over sexual assault allegations.

title.children: Yung Filly admits to reckless driving during court appearance on sex charges

image.altText: A young man in a grey button-up shirt and black pants sits in a wheelchair with his hands ion the wheels.

props.synopsis: The 24-year-old Sydney man says he was told his wheelchair posed a risk to patrons and was made to leave the dancefloor on a night out at the 3 Wise Monkeys pub with his mates.

title.children: Man kicked off Sydney pub's dancefloor because of wheelchair

image.altText: daughter holding photo

props.synopsis: Sonja Kurtzer was a "trailblazing feminist" who inevitably lost her identity in an attempt to seek "spiritual healing". Now, her daughter Ellen Bertani is on a quest for justice.

title.children: Ellen's mum sought 'spiritual healing', then stopped counselling and medication

image.altText: Australia's football superstar Sam Kerr looks sad but gives a thumbs up to the crowd after the Matildas Women's World Cup loss.

props.synopsis: Football Australia appears no closer to finding the next full-time coach for the Matildas, with no hard deadline in sight for its current exhaustive search.

title.children: No end in sight for Matildas coaching search despite 'hundreds of screenings'
